revised_title: New Developments in Electron Microscopy for Biology: Specimen Preparation Techniques
tldr: This article discusses new developments in electron microscopy with a focus on specimen preparation techniques for biological samples. It highlights the use of physical processing methods, such as the freeze-etch technique, to minimize structural deterioration during dehydration steps. Other techniques mentioned include dark field microscopy, nucleic acid absorption, and autoradiography.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Microscopy and Imaging
